result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin A Pennix was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No violent contact with Tanisha P. or her daughter.
Attend and complete Anger Management.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Perform community service dealing with battered women.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Calvin A Pennix in court with attorney Jeffrey Scott Gaines.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gaines advises the Court he has received discovery and an offer.  Attorney Gaines requests additional time for negotiations.  Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness and her daughter listed in the Criminal Complaint unless witness consents in writing with a letter to the District Attorney's Office and copy to the Court.

Defendant Calvin A Pennix in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
